Title: Refugee Camp (Quayside Tents)

Description: Canvas lanes, cookfire smoke, and the patience of people with nowhere left to go.
Paragraphs: Ropes creak in the wind and tin stoves tick as they cool. Children chalk games in the dust; a bell somewhere upriver counts the day's last bread.
Aid wagons rattle through with thin blankets and thinner mercy. Between tents, a grey-bearded elder keeps a ledger of names that is mostly crossings-out.
